business.headline: Gold and silver prices fall sharply. Should you buy now?With gold and silver prices falling sharply, investors are eyeing the market closely. Is now the right time to buy, or could prices dip further?

Amazon to cut 14,000 corporate jobs amid company's AI push to slash costsAmazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs, its biggest layoffs since 2023, as it ramps up artificial intelligence investments and trims costs under CEO Andy Jassy's ongoing restructuring plan.

Apple joins Microsoft, Nvidia in exclusive $4 trillion market-cap clubApple is now the third member of the $4 trillion market-cap club, joining Nvidia—currently valued above $4.5 trillion—and Microsoft, which re-entered the group following gains linked to its partnership with OpenAI.
Sensex, Nifty end slightly lower amid volatility and profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 75.11 points to close at 84,703.73 and the NSE Nifty50 fell 29.85 points to settle at 25,936.20.

Mehli Mistry set to exit Tata Trusts after trustees block reappointmentMehli Mistry, who joined both trusts in 2022, has been regarded as a close associate of the late Ratan Tata. The Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust together hold the largest shareholding in Tata Sons and play a central role in board nominations and governance across the Tata Group.

Cabinet clears terms of reference for 8th Pay CommissionInformation and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed that the government has finalised the commission's composition, mandate and timelines.

What's driving the 6% rise in office rentals across India's major cities?Average monthly office rentals increased from Rs 85 per sq. ft. in the first nine months of 2024 to Rs 90 per sq. ft. in the same period of 2025. Bengaluru saw the sharpest rise of about 9%, followed by steady gains in cities like Pune and Delhi-NCR.

Indian refiners halt new Russian oil deals, await clarity amid sanctions: ReportLast week, the US imposed new sanctions on Russia's two largest oil producers, Lukoil and Rosneft, expanding restrictions already in place from the European Union and the UK over the war in Ukraine. The fresh measures have forced Indian buyers to reassess supply routes and payment mechanisms.

Peyush Bansal's Lenskart IPO opens on October 31. Here's all you need to knowPeyush Bansal-led Lenskart is set to hit the primary market on October 31 with its Rs 7,278 crore IPO. Backed by a strong brand presence and rapid expansion, the issue is among the most awaited listings of 2025.

6 hidden home loan traps your bank won't tell you. Expert shares smart hacksBuying your dream home can quickly turn stressful when hidden costs and surprise clauses appear. From processing fees to "mandatory" insurance, a tax expert shares six practical hacks every borrower should know before signing their home loan papers.

How a CRPF officer fought insurer for his autistic son's treatmentWhen CRPF officer Syam Krishna's autistic son fell ill, doctors advised hospitalisation. But his insurer called it "unnecessary" and even questioned the family's claim history. This week's 'Claim Denied' story reveals how genuine policyholders are forced to fight for rightful care.

Why quitting SIPs within 3 years is a costly mistakeStarting an SIP is easy, staying invested isn't. An expert explains why most Indian investors quit too soon, and how this one mistake can cost them lakhs in the long run.

MCX glitch halts gold, silver futures trade; check latest updateIn a series of updates issued throughout the morning, MCX stated that the issue was being addressed and that trading would now commence from its Disaster Recovery (DR) site. However, the exchange did not specify a fresh start time.

Vodafone Idea share price: What are analysts saying after AGR ruling?Analysts see fresh hope for Vodafone Idea after the AGR ruling, with Motilal Oswal, Emkay, and Citi turning positive on the stock and projecting scope for further upside.

Amazon's biggest-ever layoffs: Why 30,000 jobs are on the lineThe layoffs will affect nearly 10% of Amazon's 350,000 corporate employees, though that's only a fraction of its 1.55 million total workforce.

Sensex, Nifty open flat amid profit booking; PSU banks in focus on FDI cap buzzAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was trading 66.76 points higher at 84,845.60, while the NSE Nifty50 edged up 14.25 points to 25,980.30.

Paramount to cut 1,000 jobs ahead of merger with Warner BrosThe job cuts, which follow the $8.4 billion merger between Skydance Media and Paramount Global, would impact roughly 5% of Paramount's employees based on its workforce prior to the completion of the deal.

Gold price at Rs 1.21 lakh, silver dips sharply: More correction ahead?According to analysts, the dip was both expected and healthy after gold prices shot up from nearly Rs 75,000 to Rs 1.30 lakh in just a few months. A correction of about 10–15% was on the cards, which would bring prices closer to Rs 1.15 lakh per 10 grams.

Amazon to target 30,000 corporate workers in largest ever job cuts: ReportAmazon will lay off up to 30,000 corporate employees starting Tuesday, its biggest round of cuts since 2022, as the tech giant trims costs and corrects pandemic-era overhiring across divisions.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as trade optimism boosts market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 566.96 points to close at 84,778.84, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 170.90 points to settle at 25,966.05. Broader markets also participated in the rally, even as volatility edged up ahead of the monthly F&O expiry.

entertainment.headline: Police, bomb squad conduct search at Rajinikanth, Dhanush's homes after e-mail hoax Police and bomb squad teams conducted thorough searches at the residences of Rajinikanth and Dhanush in Chennai following an e-mailed bomb threat. Authorities have confirmed the threats were false, with increased scrutiny on a recent spike in hoax threats targeting celebrities and public figures in Tamil Nadu.

Olivia Wilde joins Pedro Pascal and David Harbour in Tony Gilroy's Behemoth Olivia Wilde has become part of the cast for 'Behemoth!', the new drama directed by Tony Gilroy and set to begin filming in Los Angeles later this week. The film brings together Pedro Pascal, David Harbour, and Eva Victor for a story described as a tribute to the music of movies and the people behind it.

Exclusive: Enrique Iglesias on India, hints at rumoured collaboration with SRK Enrique Iglesias returns to Mumbai after 13 years for a two-night concert in October. In a conversation with India Today, the singer spoke about his fanbase in India and his much-awaited rumoured collaboration with Shah Rukh Khan.

Gotham Film Awards 2025 Nominations: One Battle After Another leads with six nods The 2025 Gotham Awards kicked off with Paul Thomas Anderson's 'One Battle After Another' leading nominations. On the other hand, Jacob Elordi bagged a nomination for Outstanding Supporting Performance in 'Frankenstein'.

From avoiding kiss scenes to finding faith: How Sonam Bajwa evolved in Bollywood Sonam Bajwa opened up about her journey from fearing on-screen intimacy to embracing faith and small beginnings. In this exclusive conversation, she reflected on how 'Housefull 5' and 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' helped her evolve beyond fear and self-doubt.

Travis Kelce celebrates 100th touchdown milestone Swiftie-style, dances to Ophelia Travis Kelce celebrated his 100th career touchdown with a Taylor Swift-inspired dance, delighting fans and stealing the spotlight both on and off the field. He danced to 'Ophelia' at the Arrowhead Stadium.

Only Murders in the Building renewed for season 6, Selena Gomez celebrates The popular Hulu series 'Only Murders in the Building', starring Selena Gomez, Steve Martin, and Martin Short, has been renewed for a sixth season, with filming to take place in London for the first time. The new season is expected to air in 2026.

One Piece Season 2 releases in March 2026, Netflix drops 1st look at Drum Island Netflix will bring back the Straw Hat Pirates in March as the live-action One Piece returns for its second season, introducing new characters and locations. The announcement was made on Netflix recently.

BB19 Episode 66: Farrhana Bhatt warns Tanya Mittal, Ashnoor apologises to Shehbaz The 'Bigg Boss 19' episode witnessed intense arguments and shifting alliances. The captaincy drama and kitchen conflicts fuelled rising tensions among housemates.

Bigg Boss 19: Jannat Zubair backs Ashnoor Kaur, as Tanya, Kunickaa body-shame her Actor Jannat Zubair came out strongly in support of Ashnoor Kaur amid body-shaming on 'Bigg Boss 19'. The controversy highlights ongoing challenges regarding body image and respect in Indian reality TV.

Nora Fatehi joins J Balvin, REMA and Martin Garrix to headline at UNTOLD Dubai Nora Fatehi is all set to join 'UNTOLD Dubai 2025' as a headliner alongside global stars. Her debut of a new international single adds excitement to the festival's star-studded lineup.

Captain America's Chris Evans and Alba Baptista quietly welcome first child Actor couple Chris Evans and Alba Baptista have welcomed their first child in Massachusetts. The private birth adds to their low-profile family life following a quiet 2023 wedding.

Diljit Dosanjh makes history: First Indian to sell stadium show in Sydney Diljit Dosanjh became the first Indian to sell a stadium show in Sydney. Tickets for the show were sold out, some going for as high as $800 each with 30,000 fans in attendance.

Film body urges PM Modi to confer Padma Shri posthumously on Satish Shah The Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to posthumously confer upon Padma Shri to late actor Satish Shah for his contribution to cinema and television.

Enrique Iglesias arrives in India for his two-day concert in Mumbai. Watch Spanish singer-songwriter Enrique Iglesias landed in India on Tuesday ahead of his two-day concert in Mumbai. He waved at the cameras and interacted with the paparazzi at Mumbai's Kalina Airport.

High Court halts Ravi Mohan from using Bro Code as title for film, team reacts Delhi High Court has temporarily stopped Ravi Mohan Studios from using the title 'Bro Code' due to a trademark dispute. The decision escalates legal tensions between the filmmakers and Indo-Spirit Beverages over brand rights.

Nobody Wants This Season 2 is couch potato's guide to non-toxic love done right 'Nobody Wants This Season 2' on Netflix turns ordinary domesticity into a lesson on emotional maturity. Starring Adam Brody and Kristen Bell, the show proves that communication, vulnerability, and humour can make modern love beautifully non-toxic.

Navya Nanda shares insight into Bachchan family: We don't fight, we debate Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter, Navya Naveli Nanda, recently talked about the dynamics in the Bachchan household. She highlighted that her family often has conversations around topics that are relevant today and that matter.

Kantara Chapter 1 makers clarify early OTT release: Deal was done 3 years ago 'Kantara: Chapter 1' will premiere on Prime Video on October 31, just weeks after its theatrical release. Hombale Films clarifies that the early OTT drop stems from a three-year-old agreement.

general news.headline: Cyclone Montha weakens after Andhra landfall, leaves trail of damage, 1 deadThe India Meteorological Department said Cyclone Montha weakened into a cyclonic storm after crossing the Andhra Pradesh coast, bringing heavy rain and gusty winds before gradually losing strength over land.

After cloud seeding, Delhi still dry. Minister points to low moisture factorSpeaking exclusively to India Today, Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa explained that the trial on Tuesday was conducted to check if cloud seeding can be done in moisture conditions of 10–15%.

Pakistan's Khawaja Asif accuses Kabul of being India's puppet, vows revengePakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif accused Kabul of acting as  a tool for Delhi, warning that if Afghanistan attacks Islamabad, Pakistan's response would be 50 times stronger, after peace talks collapsed.

I'm still a detainee: India-born man's new battle after 43 years in US JailSubramanyam Subu Vedam, an India-born man exonerated after 43 years in a US prison for a wrongful murder conviction, was immediately detained by ICE under a decades-old deportation order. Freed after new FBI evidence proved his innocence, 64-year-old Vedam now faces deportation to India, the country he left as a nine-month-old. Here's the story of the ordeal of the longest-serving wrongfully convicted person in Pennsylvania's history, and one of the longest in the US.

Trump's clueless stroll as he reviews guard of honour in Tokyo, video is viralTrump arrived in Tokyo on a three-day visit to Japan on Tuesday and held bilateral talks with Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi to boost defence and economic ties.

7 beautiful jets shot down: Trump repeats India-Pak ceasefire claim in JapanUS President Donald Trump said seven "brand-new, beautiful" aircrafts were shot down during the May 7–10 cross-border clashes between India and Pakistan, speaking in Tokyo as he repeated his claim of brokering the ceasefire between the two nations.

Didn't live in NYC: Zohran Mamdani trolled over 'aunt in fear after 9/11' remarkZohran Mamdani, a leading contender in the New York City mayoral race, is under scrutiny after his comments about his aunt in fear of travelling on a subway in a hijab following the 9/11 attacks. He clarified later he was talking about his father's cousin.

Landslides, fallen trees, empty streets: Cyclone Montha batters Andhra, OdishaCyclone Montha struck coastal Andhra Pradesh and Odisha with heavy rain and fierce winds. The storm left a woman dead, caused massive crop damage, and left a trail of destruction across both states.

Sridhar Vembu's vaccine comment is not science, it's dangerous speculationWhen a billionaire entrepreneur starts talking like a vaccine sceptic, the harm goes far beyond a social media post. Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu's recent claim that India's sharp rise in autism is linked to "too many childhood vaccines" is more than just misinformed; it's reckless

India, China hold talks on management of border's western section: ReportAs per the Chinese Defence Ministry, the talks, held on the Indian side of a designated meeting point on October 25, concluded with the two sides agreeing to maintain regular communication and dialogue through military and diplomatic channels.

A foreign country using Pakistan soil to hit Afghanistan with drones?A bombshell revelation has emerged in the Afghanistan-Pakistan peace talks in Turkey. Pakistan, for the first time, has admitted that it cannot prevent drone strikes inside Afghanistan due to a secret agreement with a foreign country. This comes just months after Islamabad began strengthening defence and strategic ties with the US, amid President Donald Trump's forceful public demand for the return of Bagram airbase.

7 dead, homes destroyed as Hurricane Melissa hits Jamaica; Cuba braces for impactHurricane Melissa, one of the strongest Atlantic storms on record, battered Jamaica with 185 mph winds, leaving half a million without power before moving toward Cuba on Tuesday.

Exclusive: Enrique Iglesias on India, hints at rumoured collaboration with SRKEnrique Iglesias returns to Mumbai after 13 years for a two-night concert in October. In a conversation with India Today, the singer spoke about his fanbase in India and his much-awaited rumoured collaboration with Shah Rukh Khan.

Live: Heavy rain in Andhra, landslides in Odisha after landfall, Centre assures aidCyclone Montha Live Updates: Andhra Pradesh and Odisha bore the brunt after severe cyclonic storm Montha made landfall on Tuesday. In Andhra, at least 3,778 villages were forecast to receive heavy rain until tomorrow, while a woman died in Konaseema district after an uprooted tree fell on her. Nearly 76,000 people were shifted to relief camps while the state government arranged 219 medical camps. In Odisha,  damages were reported in eight districts, while normal life was affected in a total of 15 districts. Heavy rain triggered landslides in Gajapati and Rayagada districts. In view of the extensive damages in both states, the Centre has assured all necessary assistance and emergency medical aid. On Wednesday morning, Montha had weakened into a cyclonic storm, but is likely to maintain the intensity for a period of six hours. Stay with indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

1 in 3 Bihar poll candidates face criminal charges, 40% are crorepatis: ReportA report by the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) and Bihar Election Watch reveals that 32% of candidates have declared criminal cases against themselves, including 27% facing serious charges such as murder and crimes against women.

Bloodbath in Rio as at least 64 killed in Brazil's deadliest anti-gang operationThe massive raid on Wednesday, launched just days before Rio de Janeiro hosts events linked to the upcoming COP30 climate summit, targeted the powerful Comando Vermelho drug-trafficking gang in the Complexo do Alemo and Penha favelas.

Mumbai man's 'sarcastic' apology mail on salary delay backfiresIn a now-viral post on LinkedIn, a man from Mumbai shared a sarcastic apology email about delayed salaries, and it didn't sit well with users online.

1st T20I preview: Will Abhishek Sharma stamp his authority Down Under?India vs Australia, 1st T20I Preview: With the ODIs done, the focus finally shifts to things that matter – the build-up for T20 World Cup. Suryakumar Yadav's India are set to take on Australia in a 5-match series, one that promises a battle between high-voltage batting orders.

Gold and silver prices fall sharply. Should you buy now?With gold and silver prices falling sharply, investors are eyeing the market closely. Is now the right time to buy, or could prices dip further?

Why mindful parenting is the approach every parent needs todayFor many modern parents, mindful parenting has become the secret to building a stronger bond with their child. If you have a little one, too, this approach is definitely worth trying.

From avoiding kiss scenes to finding faith: How Sonam Bajwa evolved in BollywoodSonam Bajwa opened up about her journey from fearing on-screen intimacy to embracing faith and small beginnings. In this exclusive conversation, she reflected on how 'Housefull 5' and 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' helped her evolve beyond fear and self-doubt.

Outrage as Sikh trucker who killed 3 in US crash brought in court without turbanA 21-year-old Indian truck driver, Jashanpreet Singh, accused of causing a crash that killed three in California, appeared in a US court without his turban, sparking outrage among Sikh community and leaders, including Shiromani Akali Dal chief Sukhbir Singh Badal. A petition has also been created seeking authorities to "restore his religious rights".

Zohran Mamdani faces probe after watchdog alleges foreign donations in NYC raceNew York City mayoral frontrunner Zohran Mamdani is facing fresh trouble after a campaign finance watchdog accused him of taking illegal donations from foreign contributors.

Why young Indians under 40 need to pay attention to stroke symptomsThere is a noticeable increase in stroke cases among young Indians under 40. Doctors are directly pointing to lifestyle habits, including unchecked hypertension and cholesterol.

sports.headline: South Africa look for revenge in semis against England after 69 nightmare Women's World Cup, ENG vs SA: South Africa will be looking to avenge their previous defeat to England when the two teams meet on Tuesday, October 28 at the Barsapara Stadium in Guwahati.

Australian pitches will help Suryakumar Yadav regain form, says Irfan Pathan Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan believes the Australian pitches could help Suryakumar Yadav rediscover his batting rhythm. The Indian captain has endured a lean run of form this season.

Watch: Ruturaj shares Ranji Trophy award with double centurion Prithvi Shaw Ruturaj Gaikwad shared his Player of the Match award with Prithvi Shaw after Maharashtra's Ranji Trophy win over Chandigarh. Shaw's explosive double century played a decisive role in his team's 144-run victory.

Shreyas Iyer Injury Scare: Cricketer Suffers Lacerated Spleen, Internal Bleeding This special report focuses on the critical injury sustained by Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer during the third ODI against Australia in Sydney. The BCCI confirmed the extent of the injury in a press release. According to the board, 'Shreyas Iyer sustained a blunt injury to his abdomen, resulting in a laceration of his spleen with internal bleeding on 25th October during the third ODI against Australia'. The injury, which occurred while taking a catch, was promptly identified and the bleeding was arrested, leading to his condition stabilising. Now out of the ICU, Iyer remains under the close observation of the BCCI's medical team in consultation with specialists in Sydney and India, with scans showing significant improvement on his road to recovery.

Jasprit Bumrah returns to Australia after BGT heroics in a new avatar in T20Is AUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah returns to his favourite hunting ground, Australia, where he impressed everyone with his performance in BGT last year. Now in a new role as powerplay enforcer, Bumrah will have big responsibility on him to deliver.

1st T20I preview: Will Abhishek Sharma stamp his authority Down Under? India vs Australia, 1st T20I Preview: With the ODIs done, the focus finally shifts to things that matter – the build-up for T20 World Cup. Suryakumar Yadav's India are set to take on Australia in a 5-match series, one that promises a battle between high-voltage batting orders.

Babar Azam flops as South Africa crush Pakistan by 55 runs in Rawalpindi PAK vs SA: South Africa crushed Pakistan by 55 runs in the first T20I at Rawalpindi, with George Linde starring in an all-round show. Babar Azam's return ended in disappointment as he fell for a duck, deepening Pakistan's batting woes.

Finished Kohli > Prime Babar: Fans tear into Pakistan batter after 0 on T20I return Babar Azam was heavily trolled after failing to open his account against South Africa, where Corbin Bosch dismissed him for a duck. Fans criticised the comparisons with Virat Kohli, saying Babar should not be measured against a player of Kohli's class and calibre.

Expecting an exciting South Africa contest despite group stage win: Sciver-Brunt England captain Nat Sciver-Brunt has said that she expects an exciting contest against South Africa in the semi-final despite hammering them in the group stages of the Women's World Cup 2025. South Africa were bundled out for 69 by England in the game.

Shardul Thakur eyes India return, aims to seal No.8 spot 2027 World Cup Shardul Thakur has said that he is eyeing an Indian comeback and wants to be part of the squad for the ODI World Cup 2027. Shardul was part of the India squad for the England tour and is currently the skipper of the Mumbai team.

India vs Australia, 1st T20I Preview: With the ODIs done, the focus finally shifts to things that matter – the build-up for T20 World Cup. Suryakumar Yadav's India are set to take on Australia in a 5-match series, one that promises a battle between high-voltage batting orders.

Fans criticised the comparisons with Virat Kohli, saying Babar should not be measured against a player of Kohli's class and calibre.

South Africa were bundled out for 69 by England in the game.

Shardul Thakur eyes India return, aims to seal No.8 spot 2027 World Cup Shardul Thakur has said that he is eyeing an Indian comeback and wants to be part of the squad for the ODI World Cup 2027. Shardul was part of the India squad for the England tour and is currently the skipper of the Mumbai team.

How Jasprit Bumrah, Suryakumar Yadav inspired Shreyanka Patil amid injury layoffShreyanka Patil opened up about her injury struggles and how Jasprit Bumrah and Suryakumar Yadav inspired her to stay positive and focused during her year-long layoff. The off-spinner, who missed the WPL season, is now playing in the Senior Women's T20 Trophy.

Nat Sciver-Brunt hopes India qualify for final, wants hosts to beat AustraliaNat Sciver-Brunt expressed her hope to see India reach the Women's World Cup final, saying the atmosphere would be incredible if the hosts made it. On Wednesday, England will face South Africa in the first semi-final.

Hardik Pandya's injury shifts India's balance for Australia T20Is, says Irfan PathanFormer India all-rounder Irfan Pathan says Hardik Pandya's injury will affect India's balance in the T20I series against Australia. He backs a three-pacer strategy and picks Varun Chakravarthy over Kuldeep Yadav for his mystery spin in Australian conditions.

Care Today Foundation empowers young archers in Maharashtra's WadhonaA year after we showed the story of Dipak Wanve, a teacher who doubled as an archery coach and trained his students with limited means, and now India Today Group's Care Today Foundation has stepped in to provide professional archery equipment to these aspiring athletes.

Erling Haaland could be rested for EFL Cup clash after knock: Pep GuardiolaPep Guardiola hinted that Erling Haaland maybe rested for the EFL Cup clash against Swansea City after sustaining a knock in the Premier League loss to Aston Villa.

England great James Anderson receives knighthood for services to cricketEngland fast-bowling legend James Anderson has been knighted for his services to cricket. The 43-year-old, who took 704 Test wickets over a 22-year career, received the honour from the Princess Royal at Windsor Castle after retiring from Tests in 2024.

Rizwan declines Pakistan central contract over dispute with PCB: ReportsMohammad Rizwan has reportedly declined the PCB's 2025–26 central contract, a development that follows his removal as ODI captain and exclusion from the T20I series against South Africa.

Erling Haaland could be rested for EFL Cup clash after knock: Pep GuardiolaPep Guardiola hinted that Erling Haaland maybe rested for the EFL Cup clash against Swansea City after sustaining a knock in the Premier League loss to Aston Villa.

England great James Anderson receives knighthood for services to cricketEngland fast-bowling legend James Anderson has been knighted for his services to cricket. The 43-year-old, who took 704 Test wickets over a 22-year career, received the honour from the Princess Royal at Windsor Castle after retiring from Tests in 2024.

Rizwan declines Pakistan central contract over dispute with PCB: ReportsMohammad Rizwan has reportedly declined the PCB's 2025–26 central contract, a development that follows his removal as ODI captain and exclusion from the T20I series against South Africa.

Mohammed Shami ready to make India comeback: There is cricket left in meMohammed Shami has said that he is keeping himself ready to make an Indian comeback after continuing his fine run in the Ranji Trophy this season. Shami last played for India during the Champions Trophy this year.

Dani Carvajal out for three months after knee surgery post El Clasico winReal Madrid defender Dani Carvajal has undergone successful knee surgery after El Clasico. The injury sidelines him for up to three months, impacting Madrid's defensive options.

South Africa have a really good shot at winning semis vs England: Laura WolvaardtWomen's World Cup 2025, ENG vs SA: Laura Wolvaardt said that South Africa are more than capable of taking down England in the semi-final on Wednesday in Guwahati. Earlier in the tournament, the Proteas had lost to the Brits by 10 wickets after being bowled out for 69.

Alyssa Healy on track to return for semi-final clash against IndiaAustralian skipper Alyssa Healy edges closer to a comeback in the Women's World Cup 2025 semi-final versus India after clearing a demanding fitness assessment in Mumbai. Her return will be a huge cause of concern for India as Healy earlier slammed a century in group stage clash against the hosts.

Superstar Abhishek Sharma ready to play all three formats for India: Michael ClarkeMichael Clarke feels that Abhishek Sharma is ready to play all three formats for India ahead of the T20I series against Australia. Abhishek is in imperial form in the shortest format of the game.

Alex Carey ready for Barmy Army taunts as Ashes stumping row still echoes in 2025Alex Carey is bracing for Barmy Army taunts as Australia prepare to host England in the 2025 Ashes. Two years after his stumping of Jonny Bairstow sparked a Spirit of Cricket storm, the wicketkeeper says he is ready for the noise and focused on the cricket.

England are also under pressure: Wolvaardt wants South Africa to stay calm in semisLaura Wolvaardt has urged South Africa to stay calm and trust their skills ahead of the Women's World Cup semi-final against England, emphasising mental strength over skills.

Gukesh gets his revenge on Hikaru Nakamura, but plays it cool to win over internetGukesh Dommaraju kept his cool to beat Hikaru Nakamura at the 2025 Clutch Chess Showdown, just weeks after their viral Checkmate controversy. His calm revenge win and quiet composure won over fans and the internet alike.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
